pgTitle: List of American Civil War Medal of Honor recipients: A–F

rows.text: Error: 1865 Feb 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantly planted the colors on the enemy's works in advance of the arrival of his regiment.
Error: 1864 Sep 20 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Swam the bayou under fire of the enemy and captured and brought off a boat by means of which the command crossed and routed the enemy.
Error: 1865 Feb 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
In a mounted charge, dashed into center of the enemy's line and captured the colors of the 33rd North Carolina Infantry.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 9 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Brought off from the picket line, under heavy fire, a comrade who had been shot through both legs.

Error: 1865 Jan 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. and Error: 1865 Apr 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Error: 1864 Dec This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1865 Jan This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Ticonderoga during attacks on Fort Fisher, 24 and 25 December 1864; and 13 to 15 January 1865.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party."
Error: 1863 Jul 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
While commanding the regiment, charged down the mountain side at midnight, in a heavy rain, upon the enemy's fleeing wagon train. Many wagons were captured and destroyed and many prisoners taken.
Error: 1864 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Saved, under fire, the life of a drowning soldier.
Error: 1862 Jun This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Jul 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 9 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Daring bravery and urging the men forward in a charge.
Error: 1863 Jul 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Saved a gun of his battery under heavy musketry fire, most of the horses being killed and the drivers wounded.
Error: 1865 Mar 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag and several prisoners.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Saved his regimental flag; also seized and threw a shell, with burning fuse, from among his comrades.
Battle of Fort Wagner, Morris Island
Error: 1863 Jul 18 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1862 Mar 7 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Directed the deployment of his command and held his ground, under a brisk fire of shot and shell in which he was several times wounded.
Error: 1864 Dec 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Recapture of U.S. guidon from a rebel battery.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Richmond during action against rebel forts and gunboats and with the ram Tennessee in Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864.
Error: 1863 Sep 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

At a critical stage in the battle when the 14th Corps lines were wavering and in disorder he on his own initiative bugled "to the colors" amid the 18th U.S. Infantry who formed by him, and held the enemy. Within a few minutes he repeated his action amid the wavering 2d Ohio Infantry. This bugling deceived the enemy who believed reinforcements had arrived. Thus, they delayed their attack.
Error: 1862 Dec 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 19th Georgia Infantry (C.S.A.), wresting it from the hands of the color bearer.
Error: 1862 Sep 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

While in command of a detached company, seeing his regiment thrown into confusion by a charge of the enemy, without orders made a countercharge upon the attacking column and checked the assault. Penetrated within the enemy's lines at night and obtained valuable information.
Error: 1865 Mar 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Error: 1862 Mar 14 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. and Error: 1862 Sep 14 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Jun 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Two color bearers having been shot dead one after the other, the last one far in advance of his regiment and close to the enemy's line, this soldier rushed forward, and, under a galling fire, after removing the dead body of the bearer therefrom, secured the flag and returned with it to the Union lines.
Error: 1863 Apr 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily served as one of the crew of a transport that passed the forts under a heavy fire.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Lackawanna during successful attacks against Fort Morgan, rebel gunboats and the ram Tennessee, in Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864.
Error: 1864 Jul 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

In a heroic effort to rally the disorganized troops was disabled by a severe wound. While being carried from the field he recovered somewhat and bravely started to return to his command, when he received a second wound, which necessitated amputation of his right leg.
Error: 1864 Aug 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Commanded the regiment, all the officers being disabled.
Error: 1863 Jul 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Sep 20 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
While exposed to a galling fire, went in search of another regiment, found its location, procured ammunition from the men thereof, and returned with the ammunition to his own company.
Error: 1865 Mar 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Jun 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Though seriously wounded in a bayonet charge and directed to go to the rear he declined to do so, but remained with his regiment and helped to carry the breastworks.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Richmond during action against rebel forts and gunboats and with the ram Tennessee in Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864.
Error: 1865 Apr 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Under severe fire of the enemy and of the troops in retreat, went between the lines to the assistance of a wounded and helpless comrade, and rescued him from death or capture.
Error: 1865 Jan 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily advanced with the head of the column and cut down the palisading.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Captured the enemies flag at a battle in Sailors Creek Va
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
For actions aboard the U.S.S. Lackawana during the American Civil War
Error: 1863 May 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Nearly all the officers and men of the battery having been killed or wounded, this soldier with a comrade continued to fire his gun after the guns had ceased. The piece was then dragged off by the two, the horses having been shot, and its capture by the enemy was prevented.
Error: 1862 Sep 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Was wounded and taken to the rear insensible, but when partially recovered insisted on returning to the battery and resumed command of his piece, so remaining until the close of the battle.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party."
Error: 1864 May 28 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
While acting as aide, voluntarily led a part of the line into the fight, and was twice wounded.
Error: 1864 Dec 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
When the fire of the enemy's batteries compelled the men of his detachment for a short time to seek shelter, he stood manfully at his post and for some minutes worked his gun alone.
Error: 1863 Sep 20 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Seized the colors of a retreating regiment and led it into the thick of the attack.
Error: 1864 Oct 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Shot the Confederate Gen. Dunovant dead during a charge, thus confusing the enemy and greatly aiding in his repulse.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of battle flag of the 8th Florida Infantry (C.S.A.).
Error: 1863 May 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Having voluntarily taken command of his regiment in the absence of its commander, at great personal risk and with remarkable presence of mind and fertility of resource led the command down an exceedingly precipitous embankment to the Rappahannock River and by his gallantry, coolness, and good judgment in the face of the enemy saved the command from capture or destruction.
Error: 1863 Jul 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Seized the colors and advanced with them after the color bearer had been shot
Error: 1864 Jun 18 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Distinguished bravery in action; was severely wounded
Error: 1863 Jul 28 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Defended the division train against a vastly superior force of the enemy; he was severely wounded, but remained in the saddle for 20 hours afterward until he had brought his train through in safety
Error: 1863 Feb 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Was one of a detachment of 16 men who heroically defended a wagon train against the attack of 125 cavalry, repulsed the attack and saved the train
Error: 1864 May 12 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Distinguished conduct in a desperate hand-to-hand fight while commanding the regiment
Error: 1864 May 12 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Although severely wounded, he led the regiment against the enemy, under a terrific fire, and saved a battery from capture
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Led his regiment in the charge, carrying the colors of another regiment, and when severely wounded in the right arm, incurring loss of same, he shifted the colors to the left hand, which also became disabled by a gunshot wound
Error: 1862 Sep 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily took and carried the colors into action after the color bearer had been shot.
Error: 1863 August 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Jul 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 9th Virginia Infantry (C.S.A.), wresting it from the color bearer
Error: 1865 Mar 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
In a charge, captured the flag of the 40th North Carolina (C.S.A.), the flag being taken in a personal encounter with an officer who carried and defended it.
Error: 1863 Jul 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Unsurpassed courage in battle, where he had both eyes shot out.
Error: 1864 Dec 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

While acting as aide-de-camp to a general officer, he 3 times asked permission to join his regiment in a proposed charge upon the enemy, and in response to the last request, having obtained such permission, joined his regiment and fought bravely at its head throughout the action.
Error: 1865 Feb 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Seized the regimental colors at a critical moment and by a prompt advance on the enemy caused the entire brigade to follow him; and, after being himself severely wounded, he caused himself to be lifted into the saddle and a second time rallied the line in an attempt to check the enemy.
Error: 1863 May 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Single-handedly captured 2 officers and 5 privates of the 8th Louisiana Regiment (C.S.A.).

Error: 1864 May 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. and Error: 1864 Jul 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 October 31 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Commodore Hull at the capture of Plymouth, 31 October 1864
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party."
Error: 1864 Sep 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag, during which he was wounded in the leg
Error: 1864 Dec 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of Chalmer's Division (C.S.A.).
Error: 1864 May 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Captured a regimental flag of the enemy.
Error: 1862 Dec 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantly led his regiment in battle at a critical moment.
Error: 1864 Dec 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Mar 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag belonging to Gen. Early's headquarters.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party."
Error: 1862 May 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Took command of the company in action, the captain having been wounded, the other commissioned officers being absent, and handled it with skill and bravery.
Error: 1864 December 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Conlan served on board the U.S.S. Agawam, as one of a volunteer crew of a powder boat which was exploded near Fort Fisher, 23 December 1864.
Error: 1865 April 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1862 Aug 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
The flag of his regiment having been abandoned during retreat, he voluntarily returned with a single companion under a heavy fire and secured and brought off the flag, his companion being killed.
Error: 1865 January 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Minnesota, in action during the assault on Fort Fisher, 15 January 1865.
Error: 1864 September 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Served on board the U.S.S. Howquah on the occasion of the destruction of the blockade runner Lynx, off Wilmington, 25 September 1864. Performing his duty faithfully under the most trying circumstances, Connor stood firmly at his post in the midst of a crossfire from the rebel shore batteries and our own vessels.
Error: 1864 Sep 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1862 Sep 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Volunteered at the age of 15 years to act as a cannoneer, and as such volunteer served a gun under a terrific fire of the enemy.
Error: 1864 Apr 9 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

During an attack by the enemy, voluntarily left the brigade quartermaster, with whom he had been detailed as a clerk, rejoined his command, and, acting as first lieutenant, led the line farther toward the charging enemy.
Error: 1861 July 21 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily served as an aide on the staff of Col. David Hunter and participated in the battle, his term of service having expired on the previous day.
Error: 1864 Aug 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 26 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
2nd award: Rescued a wounded comrade from a fire
Error: 1862 Dec 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Seized the regimental colors, the color bearer having been shot down, and, waving them, rallied the regiment under a heavy fire.
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Was one of a detachment of 20 picked artillerymen who voluntarily accompanied an infantry assaulting party, and who turned upon the enemy the guns captured in the assault.
Error: 1863 May 27 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Cincinnati during the attack on the Vicksburg batteries and at the time of her sinking
Error: 1862 Aug 9 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Seized a fallen flag of the regiment, the color bearer having been killed, carried it forward in the face of a severe fire, and though himself shot down and permanently disabled, planted the staff in the earth and kept the flag flying.
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Raised the fallen colors and, rushing forward in advance of the troops, placed them on the enemy's works.
Error: 1863 Oct 14 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
With one companion returned in the face of the enemy's heavy artillery fire and removed to a place of safety a severely wounded soldier who had been left behind as the regiment fell back.
Error: 1865 Apr 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag in a personal encounter with its bearer.
Error: 1864 May 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Individually demanded and received the surrender of 7 armed Confederates concealed in a cellar, disarming and marching them in as prisoners of war.

Error: 1862 December 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1862 December 27 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Cotton served on board the U.S.S. Baron De Kalb in the Yazoo River expedition, 23 to 27 December 1862
Error: 1864 May 9 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

During a sudden night attack upon Burnham's Brigade, resulting in much confusion, this officer, without waiting for orders, led his regiment forward and interposed a line of battle between the advancing enemy and Hunt's Battery, repulsing the attack and saving the guns.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Bravely defended the colors planted on the outward parapet of Fort Hill.
Error: 1862 May 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of a flag after a severe hand-to-hand contest; was mentioned in orders for his gallantry.
Error: 1863 May 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
One of a party of 4 who voluntarily brought in a wounded Confederate officer from within the enemy's line in the face of a constant fire.
Error: 1864 May 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Sep 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

As captain of a gun on board the U.S.S. Richmond during action against rebel forts and gunboats and with the ram Tennessee in Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864. Despite damage to his ship and the loss of several men on board as enemy fire raked her decks, Cripps fought his gun with skill and courage throughout a furious 2-hour battle which resulted in the surrender of the rebel ram Tennessee and in the damaging and destruction of batteries at Fort Morgan.
Error: 1864 Oct 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily led a charge, which resulted in the capture of 14 prisoners and in which he himself was wounded.
Error: 1864 Oct 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Oct 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Took the place of a gunner who had been shot down and inspired his comrades by his bravery and effective gunnery, which contributed largely to the defeat of the enemy.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Richmond in action at Mobile Bay on 5 August 1864
Error: 1864 Jul 20 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Severely wounded and ambushed by the enemy, he stripped the colors from the staff and brought them back into the line.
Error: 1861 Jul 18 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

With a companion, refused to retreat when the part of the regiment to which he was attached was driven back in disorder, but remained upon the skirmish line for some time thereafter, firing upon the enemy.
Error: 1865 Mar 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Oct 14 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 22d or 28th North Carolina (C.S.A.).
Error: 1863 May 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Rendered great assistance in the heat of the action in rescuing a part of the field batteries from an extremely dangerous and exposed position.

Error: 1864 Aug This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1864 Nov This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party."
Error: 1862 Sep 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily exposed himself to great danger by going to the fighting line there succoring the wounded and helpless and conducting them to the field hospital.
Error: 1862 Aug 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily sought the line of battle and alone and unaided captured 2 prisoners, driving them before him to regimental headquarters at the point of the bayonet.
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Seized the colors of his regiment after 2 color bearers had fallen, bore them gallantly, and was among the first to gain a foothold, with his flag, inside the enemy's works.
Error: 1865 Jan 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
The first man to pass through the stockade, he personally led each assault on the traverses and was 4 times wounded.
Error: 1865 Apr 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 May 10 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Distinguished gallantry in leading his regiment in a charge on a house occupied by the enemy.
